title: Third Choice in Versus: Democracy!
body:
We don’t have to choose between one God King and another.  Runeterrans, we can rule ourselves!  Let’s make our own choices, like this one, right here in this thread.

Show your support for a free Runeterra here.

actually... it depends on which part of history you're in.

the word is associated with a set of government beliefs, but those change daily.

in actuality what a party calls itself has little to do with their policies.



one of the interesting facts of american history is that at one point in time we had two democratic parties with opposing policies. and one of those actually ended up being the modern day republican party while the other was replaced several times before becoming the democratic party we have today.


the idea behind a party calling itself republican is that they're for more governmental control through indirect representation.

the idea behind a party calling itself democratic is that they're for more individual control through direct representation.

but as i said above that rarely rings true. typically it's just a way to get people over to your side by using labels.

as a republic means you have a president and other representatives that are voted into office.

a democracy means that anyone eligible can vote and be elected. it's intended to be a system led by the people.

-----

that means the entire joke is erroneous. one is a form of government hierarchy while the other is a system for approval. you're voting for chaos and order. same as with yasuo and riven.

This is a classical republic. Not a democracy and really it's more of a democratic monarchy like the Mongols had or a Communist democracy. A true democracy or even a modern one, would allow for a rule to rise up organically and capture the support of the people, or the people would create their own governing system. Voting between two kings (though isn't Garen a prince?) The current form is someone telling us what leaders to choose from and not letting us decide between the two, even if both are bad.
